doc:
Alice Pearce https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice_Pearce 0 Alice Pearce (October 16, 1917 – March 3, 1966) was an American actress. She was brought to Hollywood by Gene Kelly to reprise her Broadway performance in the film version of On the Town (1949). Pearce played comedic supporting roles in several films, before being cast as nosy neighbor Gladys Kravitz in the television sitcom Bewitched in 1964. She won the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series posthumously after the second season of the series. She died from ovarian cancer in 1966. Alice_Pearce ( October_16_,_1917 – March_3_,_1966 ) was an_American_actress . She was_brought to Hollywood by Gene_Kelly to_reprise her_Broadway_performance in the_film_version of On_the_Town_(_1949_) . Pearce played comedic_supporting_roles in several_films , before being_cast as nosy_neighbor_Gladys_Kravitz in the_television_sitcom Bewitched in 1964 . She won the_Primetime_Emmy_Award for Outstanding_Supporting_Actress in a_Comedy_Series posthumously after the_second_season of the_series . She died from ovarian_cancer in 1966 .
